questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Named Entity Recognition (NER) in NLP?
In the context of NER, what is a "named entity"?
Which statement best describes a lexicon-based approach to NER?

options.A: It uses a pre-prepared dictionary for matching entity names
options.B: It learns entity categories from labeled data
options.C: It generates artificial entities for testing
options.D: It always outperforms machine learning approaches

sections.title: Section 3: NER Limitations and Best Practices

questions.question: Which approach is most suitable for identifying entities that follow well-defined textual patterns (e.g., capitalized cities or company names)?

options.A: Poor performance on entities not in the dictionary
options.B: Difficulty handling new or misspelled names
options.C: Inability to identify entities with multiple meanings (ambiguity)
options.D: Always requires a large, labeled training dataset in addition to the lexicon

questions.question: According to the lecture, what is a common trait of state-of-the-art NER models today?

options.D: They ignore entities related to products
